intro: Echites scandens, commonly known as the climbing echites, is a vine-like plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Echites scandens is often found growing in moist, shaded areas in its natural habitat.
